action_items.task: Create a user research plan and share with the team.
Lead the visual design phase and involve the brand team.
Schedule a workshop with the brand team for visual direction.
Put together a comparison of the top three headless CMS options, including pros, cons, and cost analysis.
Work with Jordan on the content audit.
Develop a testing checklist covering functionality, responsiveness, accessibility, and browser compatibility.
Send out a recurring meeting invite for weekly check-ins.
Prepare a presentation for the leadership team on the budget.
Work on preliminary mockups for the executive presentation.

decisions.context: Increased bounce rate, confusing navigation, and outdated visual design necessitated a redesign.
Exploration of alternatives indicated a headless CMS offers more flexibility, better performance, and easier long-term maintenance.
To ensure ongoing progress and coordination throughout the project.

key_points: Driving factors: 23% increase in bounce rate, confusing navigation, need for visual modernization.
Target launch date: End of January (approx. 3 months).
Phases: User research, information architecture, visual design, technical implementation, content audit, QA.
User research to involve at least 20 users across segments.
Exploration and recommendation for a new CMS (headless CMS suggested).
Need for executive buy-in on budget.
Project requires collaboration between Emily, Carlos, Mia, and Jordan.
summary.tldr: This meeting kicked off the website redesign project, driven by increased bounce rates and confusing navigation. The team outlined a three-month timeline aiming for an end-of-January launch, with key phases including user research, information architecture, and visual design.
